thread.section_title: CNBC International – World Business News Leader
thread.title: Earny: The most popular purchases in every state

author: Sarah Berger
title: Earny: The most popular purchases in every state
text:
Ever wonder what residents in your neighbor states are shopping for? The most popular purchases by state, it turns out, vary greatly.
Earny , an app that gets you money back on things you buy based on receipts in your inbox, analyzed over 100 million purchases made by its users between Nov. 1 and Feb 1 (to look at holiday season shopping). The app identified the top sellers in every state and Washington, D.C.
While people in some states — like Texas and California — treated themselves to tech toys, residents in other areas were much practical, opting for items like toilet paper and cat food.
Then there were the odd purchases (Ohioans love lava lamps) the trendy (Nevada residents were caught up in the bitcoin craze, buying cryptocurrency wallets) and the ones that made the most sense, geographically (Washington D.C.'s top pick was the book "Obama: An Intimate Portrait").
Items not taken into consideration for the analysis were personal voice assistants and detergents, because those products, Earny says, were the most popular items during the time period for every state. 
The most popular purchases by state, according to Earny users data, were:
Alabama: pressure cooker Alaska: tumeric pain relief Arizona: table air hockey game Arkansas: Essentia water California: iPhone X screen protector Colorado: "Ancestry" DNA kit Connecticut: Indian healing clay Delaware: printer Florida: Super Mario Odyssey Georgia: aromatherapy oils Hawaii: portable karaoke speaker Idaho: "Wonder" book (a movie based on the novel by R.J. Palacio hit theaters this winter) Illinois: PopSockets (a mount that attaches to the back of your phone to give you a better grip) Indiana: SanDisk memory (for memory storage on tech devices) Iowa: Fujifilm film Kansas: electronic duck-hunting game Kentucky: Fire HD 8-inch tablet Louisiana : flu symptoms pellets Maine: Banpresto figure (a type of action figure) Maryland: USB cable Massachusetts: "What do you Meme?" party game Michigan : Fingerlings baby monkey Minnesota: cat food Mississippi: phone belt clip holster Missouri: "Giraffes Can't Dance" book Montana: smart light bulbs Nebraska: exercise mats Nevada: Ledger Nano crypto hardware wallet New Hampshire: snow broom and ice scraper New Jersey: Diet Coke New Mexico: clip-on hair extensions New York : Alexa smart plug North Carolina: Duraflame fire log North Dakota: glue Ohio: lava lamp Oklahoma: Amazon Dash button Oregon : garden toolset Pennsylvania: storm-proof auto cover Rhode Island: gaming chair rocker South Carolina: toilet paper South Dakota: carpet cleaner Tennessee: electric toothbrush Texas: Fire 7-inch tablet Utah: Moviepass subscription Vermont: puppy pads Virginia: electronic dartboard Washington: dollhouse Washington D.C.: "Obama: An Intimate Portrait" book West Virginia: chocolate bars Wisconsin: oil diffuser Wyoming: stevia Don't miss: Walmart: Here's what people are buying the most in every state
